meanings.definition: A quick and simple sewing stitch used to join two pieces of fabric together.
meanings.sent1: She used whipstitches to attach the buttons to the shirt.
meanings.sent2: The tailor finished the hem with neat whipstitches.
meanings.sent3: In a rush, she sewed on the patch with whipstitches, creating a quirky look.
meanings.sent4: The whipstitches of friendship held them together through thick and thin.
meanings.sent5: The colorful whipstitches added a playful touch to the quilt.

meanings.definition: To quickly and haphazardly repair or mend something.
meanings.sent1: He had to whipstitch the torn seam before the party.
meanings.sent2: She whipstitches her torn backpack to make it last a bit longer.
meanings.sent3: In a hurry, he whipstitched the broken strap, hoping it would hold.
meanings.sent4: She whipstitches her way through minor repairs like a pro.
meanings.sent5: The tailor had to whipstitch the ripped costume backstage.

meanings.definition: A sudden or unexpected action or event.
meanings.sent1: The whipstitch of lightning lit up the dark sky.
meanings.sent2: The meeting ended with a whipstitch that surprised everyone.
meanings.sent3: The sudden whipstitch of applause caught her off guard.
meanings.sent4: His decision to leave was a whipstitch that changed everything.
meanings.sent5: The whipstitch of laughter broke the tension in the room.
